abstract.text: A task that responds to background URL sessions.

inlineContent.text: Always upload and download data using a

background transfer. Background transfers occur in a separate process and continue to transfer data even after your app terminates. Asynchronous uploads and downloads, on the other hand, suspend with your app. Because watchOS apps have a short runtime, you can’t guarantee that an asynchronous transfer finishes before the app suspends. For more information on background transfers, see
Schedule a background URL session to download an item as shown below.

code: // Create the background download task and schedule it to run in 15 minutes.

inlineContent.text: If your app has a complication on the active watch face, it can receive up to four
tasks per hour. To avoid throttling, use the
property to schedule background URL session tasks no closer than 15 minutes apart.
Don’t subclass or create instances of this class. Instead, the system instantiates a
object and passes the task object to your extension delegate’s
method until all the delegate method calls finish processing.
In watchOS 9 and later, SwiftUI Background tasks are the preferred way to handle background tasks and interactions. For more information,
task when any of the following events occur:
The server requires authentication to complete a background transfer.
All background transfers associated with a session identifier complete (either successfully or unsuccessfully).

To get more information about the transfer, create a background configuration object with the same session identifier. Next, create a session object using the configuration object and a session delegate. The system automatically associates the new session with the transfer and calls the appropriate delegate methods.

abstract.text: Runs the specified action when the system provides a background task.
Create tasks that download files while your app is inactive.
An object that coordinates a group of related, network data transfer tasks.
The earliest date at which the network load should begin.
Build watchOS apps that use features the app delegate monitors or controls, such as background tasks and extended runtime sessions.
Tells the delegate that the app has received one or more background tasks.
A task that updates your app’s state in the background.
A task for handling timely Bluetooth alerts in the background.
A background task used to update your app after a SiriKit intent runs.
The abstract superclass for WatchKit’s background task classes.
A background task used to periodically donate relevant Siri shortcuts.
A background task used to update your app’s user interface in preparation for a snapshot.
A task that responds to background URL sessions.
The identifier for the triggering background transfer.
A background task used to receive background updates from the Watch Connectivity framework.
Provide a timely, accurate snapshot of your app by using snapshot background tasks.

doc://com.apple.watchkit/documentation/W.title: Preparing to take your watchOS app’s snapshot

abstract.text: Handle scheduled update tasks in the background, and respond to background system interactions including Siri intents and incoming Bluetooth messages.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
